page.title: 07LYNN LAW FARM, WHALTON.
page.content: Originally spelt Linn Law which means hill of water (there are 5 natural springs on the farm) it is now owned by Bob and Rita Forsyth who bought the farm in l979. It extends to 200 acres of which 110 acres are arable growing winter barley,oats and turnips. The remainder being used for pasture and hay. This year they produced 3,000 bales of hay for winter feed. There are 150 Suffolk X ewes, 3 rams and 100 black-face hogs being fattened for market. There are also 70-80 Charolais -Hereford stirks which are bought in at 3-6months and sent to market at 10-12months.The farm is run by Bob and his son with casual help at harvest time. They own 3 tractors and a combine-harvester. Dutch elm disease has killed 16 trees on the farm but there are no immediate plans to replace them.
